name: Margaux
tasting_note: Warmed cassis and plum notes form the core, while lilting lilac, violet and iris accents stream throughout. Offers a flash of black tea on the finish, along with a beguiling, cashmerelike mouthfeel. Judicious toast lets it all play out beautifully. A pitch-perfect example of the vintage profile. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2026 through 2040. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast UV-SL Vineyard
tasting_note: Offers a stunning mix of crème brûlée, orange curd and peach preserves, with so much depth and complexity to the range of details, including wildflower honey and apricot pastry, plus spicy accents of nutmeg and Saigon cinnamon. Toffee and a touch of smoked salt linger on the finish. Drink now through 2035. 2,357 cases made.

name: Lytton Springs Dry Creek Valley
tasting_note: Deeply structured and full of tension, this polished red displays a distinctive personality, offering bold blackberry flavors accented with savory anise, black pepper and dark Asian spices. Ends with big but refined tannins. Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Carignane, Alicante Bouschet and Mataro. Drink now through 2035. 11,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Eastside Road Neighbors
tasting_note: Captures the floral-laced purity of the vintage, with a beautiful beam of boysenberry and loganberry puree flanked with light briar and apple wood notes, all set against a hibiscus-, iris- and violet-filled backdrop. The succulent energy provides a great underpinning for it all. Best from 2026 through 2040. 2,600 cases made.

name: St.-Emilion
tasting_note: This is very fresh, expressive and focused, with violet, iris and rosehip notes darting to the fore, while flavors of sleek raspberry and red currant preserves race along behind. Almost flattering, but there's a subtle chalky tension piercing the finish, which sails through. A dreamy wine. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2026 through 2040. 6,250 cases made, 1,600 cases imported.

name: Apalta
tasting_note: Aromatically complex and intriguing, this offers a spiced plum pastry note that melds with petrichor, pine, dried violet and cocoa powder elements. The palate is round and richly textured, with Szechuan peppercorn accents to the concentrated black cherry, plum and cassis center. Everything comes together harmoniously on the finish and lingers, with present but integrated tannins. A stunner that should develop nicely in the cellar. Carmenère, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2040. 11,169 cases made, 1,500 cases imported.

name: Barbaresco
tasting_note: A vibrant, well-defined red, offering rose, cherry, strawberry, white pepper and mineral flavors. Sleek and elegant, this firms up on the linear finish. Balanced and approachable now yet would benefit from a bit more time to knit together. Excellent length. Best from 2027 through 2040. 24,000 cases made, 7,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Fort Ross-Seaview Wayfarer Vineyard The Estate
tasting_note: Offers beautifully rendered notes of hibiscus, rose petal, damson plum and mulberry that stretch out lengthily thanks to the fine-beaded acidity and taut, precise tannins. The sapid finish lets in tea and incense hints amid the glistening fruit. Best from 2026 through 2036. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico San Lorenzo Gran Selezione
tasting_note: Deep, dark and densely wrought, featuring black cherry, blackberry, violet, iron and tobacco aromas and flavors. The sinewy tannins are enhanced by the vivid acidity, and everything comes together on the crystalline aftertaste, which echoes the fruit and floral elements. Power meets finesse. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best from 2028 through 2050. 7,715 cases made, 1,000 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape St.-Préfert
tasting_note: Supple and mouthfilling, with silky tannins upholding cherry, plum and pretty lavender notes. Grilled garrigue plays out on the finish, which shows sneaky length and elegance. Seductive in feel, with impressive energy, too, for a balanced, harmonious impression. Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2040. 2,500 cases made, 900 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Mt. Jefferson Cuvée
tasting_note: This impressive Pinot is polished and detailed, offering dynamic flavors of raspberry and blueberry, with mineral and brown baking spice hints that build richness toward fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2035. 11,870 cases made.

name: Bedrock Vineyard Heritage Sonoma Valley
tasting_note: This impeccably structured red is infused with personality and polish, unfolding with black cherry and raspberry flavors framed by orange peel, garrigue, brown baking spices and clove while building richness and tension toward medium-grained tannins. Zinfandel, Carignan and Mataro. Drink now through 2035. 1,200 cases made.

name: St.-Julien
tasting_note: This delivers an energetic tumble of blackberry, boysenberry and black currant paste flavors injected with bramble and apple wood and supported by a licorice snap accent. The strapping finish is laced with violet and iris notes, while a cast iron edge lends bass. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2027 through 2045. 24,000 cases made, 2,400 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
tasting_note: Aromas of violet and wild herbs give way to flavors of black cherry, blackberry and black currant in this tense, saturated red, which is just beginning to relax and open up now, six years after the harvest. Shows terrific balance, with a long, black pepper–infused aftertaste. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now through 2045. 5,000 cases made, 2,500 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
tasting_note: An excellent example of classic Châteauneuf richness that shows good balance and energy. Juicy black raspberry, licorice and ganache are wrapped around a ballast of graphite shavings, while the refined structure reins in the warm, mouthcoating palate. Hints of grilled herbs, brown bread and lavender smoke detail the long, textured and mineral-rich finish. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Cinsault. Best from 2026 through 2038. 5,000 cases made, 1,200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Avni
tasting_note: Dynamic and precise, this features a core of steely acidity that frames expressive flavors of raspberry and guava, laced with crushed stone, forest floor and dusky spice notes that gather tension and richness toward fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2033. 18,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Ducale Riserva
tasting_note: There's intensity to this red, which showcases flavors of cherry, boysenberry and blood orange, with iron, underbrush and tobacco notes peeking through as this builds to the lingering aftertaste. Verges on racy courtesy of the bracing acidity, with excellent length. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2040. 130,000 cases made, 90,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
tasting_note: This white’s sleek mix of ripe pear, ginger and pomelo flavors show striking restraint, coiled around a mouthwatering thread of acidity. Details of lime zest, white peppercorn and dried tarragon linger, along with a whiff of sea spray. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
tasting_note: Capturing the essence of Willamette Valley, this Pinot is elegantly structured and vibrant with acidity yet plush and polished. Flavors of raspberry and cherry are accented by orange peel, floral tea and spices as this glides along the vibrant finish. Drink now through 2032. 10,589 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Single Vineyard
tasting_note: Lush and intense, with mouthwatering notes of Key lime, tangerine and lemon cream. Hints of matcha, freshly grated ginger and white pepper add complexity and aromatics through the intense finish, where the flavors gain torque, power and freshness. Drink now. 6,065 cases made, 2,706 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
tasting_note: There's bright cherry and strawberry fruit in this elegant red, along with rose, mineral and wild herb notes, plus a hint of black pepper. Harmonious and vibrant, this is fluid while cruising to the long, detailed aftertaste. Best from 2027 through 2043. 15,800 cases made, 2,500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast
tasting_note: Ripe, succulent peach, apricot and mango flavors are generous and juicy, with notes of toasted coconut, crème anglaise, tangerine and orange blossoms, plus a drizzle of wildflower honey. The intensity persists on the finish, with hints of shortbread and grilled pineapple that linger. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Maremma Toscana Ornello
tasting_note: Well-marked by toasty oak, yet there are saturated flavors of black cherry, blackberry and plum embedded in this powerful red. Though broad and beefy, this is also polished and complex, with a persistent, fruit-filled aftertaste. Iron and herb accents add detail. Sangioveto, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best from 2026 through 2038. 5,000 cases made, 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Clarksburg Dry
tasting_note: Offers a firm, intense, juicy and refreshing mix of vibrant apricot, peach and Honeycrisp apple flavors, with a hint of jasmine and a long, refreshing finish. The succulent texture, purity of flavor and long finish are particularly impressive. Drink now. 9,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
tasting_note: This beefy red relies on its dense texture, concentrated flavors of black cherry and blackberry fruit, and muscular tannins to get its message across. Wild herb, iron and earth notes add depth, while the finish is long and spicy. Best from 2027 through 2043. 16,600 cases made, 5,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Etiqueta Negra Gran Reserva
tasting_note: Hibiscus and red currant notes pave the way for this elegant, suave-textured red. Doesn’t want for fruit, with fresh and juicy raspberry, Santa Rosa plum and red currant flavors, plus graphite and herbal shadings to keep this honest. Finishes with refined tannins. Nice length. Drink now through 2038. 15,000 cases made, 1,900 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc-Viognier American
tasting_note: Offers a lovely mix of ripe peach, apricot and orange blossom notes that are effusive, juicy and decidedly drinkable on a plump frame. Details of ripe pear, melon and dried ginger linger on the finish effortlessly alongside a hint of white tea. Chenin Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 180,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Centine
tasting_note: Sleek despite dusty tannins, this red displays blackberry, plum and boysenberry fruit, accented by spices and earth. Bright acidity keeps this focused. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2030. 75,000 cases made, 28,000 cases imported.

name: Coteaux Varois en Provence Roseblood Rosé
tasting_note: A fragrant, floral rosé, with a burst of watermelon and strawberry lemonade notes. Maintains vibrant energy from start to finish, with a saline mineral foundation offsetting the creamy fruit. Balanced and delicious, showing a waft of smoke on the well-meshed finish. Grenache, Syrah, Cinsault and Rolle. Drink now. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Margaux
tasting_note: Lush in its fruit, with waves of dark currant and blackberry reduction, this also shows form thanks to alder, tobacco and savory accents providing cut, while rose hip and dried violet notes add lift. Offers a long, smoldering finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2026 through 2040. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Nipozzano Riserva
tasting_note: Dark cherry, plum, earth and tobacco flavors are enmeshed in the lush texture of this broad red. There are solid tannins and bright acidity for support as this fades on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2030. 83,333 cases made, 15,000 cases imported.

name: Annia California
tasting_note: Offers a refreshing, distinctive and aromatic mix of lemon blossoms, wildflower honey, marzipan, ripe and salted melon, and apricot. Vibrant acidity keeps the flavors fresh and light on their feet, and a note of wild fennel lingers effortlessly. Ribolla Gialla, Tocai Friulano, Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco. Drink now. 3,164 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough tee
tasting_note: Stylish, with fragrant notes of lemon balm, basil and toasted green tea to complement the core of yuzu, pomelo and marmalade. The acidity is sleek and mouthwatering, with details of white pepper and candied ginger lingering on the finish. Drink now. 2,250 cases imported.

name: GSM Santa Barbara County
tasting_note: Elegant and deeply imbued with notes of violet and mace, this red offers a savory core of grilled rosemary, white pepper and graphite, along with rich, generous layers of wild strawberry and brambly raspberry that carry on through the finish around suave tannins. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2035. 2,200 cases made.

name: The Blend Apalta
tasting_note: Fans of savory styles will enjoy this red, with a bay leaf and olive cast to the plum and cherry pit core. Generous fresh acidity moves things along, picking up herb and loam accents on the finish around structured tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Malbec, Petit Verdot, Carmenère and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 13,000 cases made, 9,300 cases imported.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
tasting_note: Bright Meyer lemon and crisp yellow apple flavors form a plump core, while verbena and quinine notes add zip through the juicy finish. Drink now through 2028. 4,004 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton Shea Vineyard
tasting_note: Precise and detailed, with a slightly brooding core that propels its dark cherry and raspberry flavors, which are accented by blood orange and spiced tea tones as this gathers tension and tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2035. 1,330 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Extra Quality
tasting_note: A graceful Champagne, with a fine, raw silk–like mousse carrying well-meshed flavors of poached quince and pear, Marcona almond, oyster shell and white blossoms. Fresh and focused, with savory hints of mineral and herbs on the finish. Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier. Disgorged October 2024. Drink now through 2035. 3,000 cases made, 2,083 cases imported.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley Old Vine
tasting_note: Sleek and briary yet refined, with handsome flavors of raspberry and huckleberry accented by green peppercorn and roasted sage. Finishes with zesty tannins. Drink now through 2033. 1,282 cases made.

producer: La Granja Nuestra Señora de Remelluri
name: Rioja Reserva
tasting_note: There's a bright, buoyant feel to this fluid red. Its frame of mandarin orange peel acidity and chalky tannins is well-meshed with a dark and expressive core of macerated blackberry and black plum skin. Fragrant notes of leather, dried flowers, mountain herbs, licorice and paprika add depth to the fruit profile and linger on the finish. Tempranillo, Garnacha and Graciano. Drink now through 2040. 25,000 cases made, 2,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Estate
tasting_note: Rich and structured at the core, with handsome flavors of raspberry and pomegranate laced with forest floor and dusky spices as this gathers tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2033. 11,700 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
tasting_note: A vivacious Zin, this is detailed and briary, with energetic flavors of raspberry and cherry accented by savory anise and black pepper as this gathers tension toward zesty tannins. Drink now through 2035. 1,827 cases made.

name: Malbec Agrelo Single Vineyard Reserva
tasting_note: Structured and balanced, this leads with a generous layer of floral cassis and blackberry. Graphite and herb notes chime in around the fresh, mineral-driven center. Finishes with nice length around well-formed tannins. Drink now through 2030. 9,600 cases made, 4,800 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Moonlight Race
tasting_note: Elegant, plush and lush, with fresh flavors of black cherry, raspberry preserves and lingonberry jam. Herbal accents of dried thyme, sage and matcha, along with whiffs of white pepper and crushed pine needle, linger on the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2038. 2,500 cases made, 450 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico San Donato in Poggio Il Poggio Gran Selezione
tasting_note: Balsamic aromas lead off, and this red stays on the savory side, revealing eucalyptus, juniper and wild herb notes. There’s a core of sweet fruit and an underlying mineral element as this builds to the excruciatingly long and complex aftertaste. Dense tannins and lively acidity endure its longevity. Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Colorino. Best from 2028 through 2050. 833 cases made, 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Estate
tasting_note: This delightfully pure red lets a refreshing breeze of bitter cherry, rose petal and pomegranate notes sail through unadorned, while fresh acidity and sleek, underlying minerality provide support for the lengthy, precise finish. A wine of charm that will age nicely. Best from 2026 through 2036. 935 cases made.

name: Gigondas
tasting_note: Expressive notes of pomegranate and raspberry show pretty lavender perfume alongside wafts of apple wood smoke and black pepper. Fine yet substantial tannins hold a firm grip, with graphite power building. Concentrated and firmly structured on a sleek, powerful frame. Tightly wound, this will be even better with a few years in the cellar. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Cinsault. Best from 2026 through 2037. 930 cases imported.

name: Douro Altano
tasting_note: A lively, well-spiced red, with an appealing mix of brambly boysenberry, cherry, violet and blood orange peel flavors sculpted by light, taut tannins, ending with a minerally finish. Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca. Drink now through 2030. 42,000 cases made, 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
tasting_note: A lovely, silky white, with vivid acidity and a subtle streak of chalky sapidity layered with flavors of yellow apple, pear, lemon meringue and chamomile, plus a rich touch of hazelnut. Refreshing hints of quinine and grapefruit pith make a sweep on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 10,000 cases made, 2,000 cases imported.

name: Mendoza
tasting_note: Supremely structured and rather muscular in style, this offers a loam and iron base, juxtaposed against subtle floral and dried thyme notes that mix with a dense, compact core of cherry and Santa Rosa plum. For all this muscle, there’s finesse on the finish, with mace and floral red currant details lingering around well-formed tannins. Built to cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Petit Verdot. Best from 2036 through 2040. 8,333 cases made, 1,600 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
tasting_note: A rock-solid Cab, offering a steady beam of warmed cassis and cherry reduction notes laced with a loamy accent to keep everything grounded. Dark tobacco and a flash of walnut husk add range through the finish, which hasn’t fully unwound just yet. Best from 2026 through 2036. 12,734 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna Paganelli Riserva
tasting_note: A mix of fruity and savory, this red offers a distinctive ray of graphite, along with cherry, strawberry, juniper, tomato leaf, earth and sanguine flavors. There's good grip on the finish, but the tannins are softer and broader, more chalky than piercing. Shows fine balance and length, needing a little more time to knit together. Best from 2028 through 2046. 3,300 cases made, 1,500 cases imported.

name: Veracity Paso Robles Willow Creek District
tasting_note: A dynamic and energetic red, with garrigue, licorice and mushroom powder details to the dense, ripe huckleberry and black cherry core, which carries on well through the finish and is loaded with fresh pepper and loamy details that gather around well-integrated tannins. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2035. 907 cases made.

name: Sancerre Les Boucauds
tasting_note: A richly styled version, with hints of warm hay and beeswax atop a core of apple and preserved lemon. Waxy in feel, with real weight to the lush palate. Savory, succulent acidity slices through, maintaining balance and tension. Delicious through the long, mineral-rich, salty finish, where there’s a hint of blanched almond. Drink now through 2030. 3,500 cases made, 700 cases imported.

name: Barolo Cannubi
tasting_note: Well-defined raspberry, cherry, menthol, iron, tar and woodsy aromas and flavors mark this intense, linear red. Juicy fruit and dense tannins square off, both heightened by the vibrant acidity. Shows fine balance, but just needs time. Best from 2029 through 2047. 2,250 cases made, 600 cases imported.

name: Montsant Dido La Universal
tasting_note: A well-spiced red that’s light on its feet, this fresh, medium-bodied example offers crushed raspberry and strawberry fruit, dried rosemary and lavender, milled pepper, graphite and mineral notes. Lightly chewy on the lingering finish. Grenache, Carinyena, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2031. 8,400 cases made, 1,100 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
tasting_note: Plump and inviting, with a burst of red and black cherry compote backed by hazelnut husk, date, green fig and baking spice notes. Generous in feel, but with the underlying zip for balance and focus. Drink now. 15,000 cases made, 4,800 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Eagle Peak Estate Vineyard
tasting_note: Offers expressive and fan-friendly black cherry and boysenberry compote flavors laced with black licorice and iris hints, all backed by a prominent roasted apple wood accent on the finish. For those who like the big fruit style. Best from 2026 through 2029. 1,400 cases made.

name: Rioja Pies Rotos
tasting_note: An enticing red, showing appealing aromas and flavors of black raspberry coulis, warm fig, violet and mountain herbs, plus a stony mineral character. Animated by bright acidity, this shows good length, with a pleasing touch of tension focusing the light, chewy finish. Tempranillo and Graciano. Drink now through 2030. 5,000 cases made, 800 cases imported.

name: Gravels California
tasting_note: This fresh red leads with rubbed sage and floral notes before joining lively and crisp berry and pomegranate flavors. The generous acidity lifts the flavors onto the finish around firming, gravelly tannins, plus late hints of cherry and herbs. Grenache, Carignane and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2034. 900 cases made.

name: Brut Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore
tasting_note: A pure beam of juicy yellow peach is laced with jasmine, ginger, white pepper, honey and mineral notes in this vibrant, well-meshed Prosecco. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 12,200 cases made, 700 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
tasting_note: Appealing for its generous flavors of mandarin orange, passion fruit, lime zest and yuzu at the core. There's an appealingly fleshy, juicy texture and plenty of momentum on the finish, where lemon balm and ginger linger. Drink now. 10,000 cases made, 3,000 cases imported.

name: Garnacha-Tempranillo Campo de Borja Barambán Edición Limitada
tasting_note: A robust, nicely oaky red, with rich flavors of blackberry coulis, fig cake, garrigue, mocha and toast supported by sculpted tannins and lively, balsamico-infused acidity. Fragrant floral and spice notes linger on the finish. Garnacha and Tempranillo. Best from 2027 through 2032. 2,200 cases made, 1,100 cases imported.

name: Lazio Montiano
tasting_note: Fragrant and enticing, with warm spice and dried flower aromas accenting flavors of baked black cherry and cured tobacco, plus hints of dark chocolate and black licorice. This is suave and well-meshed, with a bit of a dark, brooding feel paired to fresh focus and length. Supple tannins emerge to firm the finish. Drink now through 2035. 770 cases imported.

name: Garnacha-Syrah Calatayud Las Pizarrras Fabla #506
tasting_note: A fruit-forward red, loaded with ripe mulberry, boysenberry and plum fruit, with accompanying aromatics of rosemary, anise, graphite and peppercorn. Thick and creamy on the palate, with bright, blood orange–infused acidity and lightly chalky tannins firming the finish. Garnacha and Syrah. Drink now through 2030. 17,000 cases made, 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Sandy's Block
tasting_note: This is coiled up, offering juicy energy that keeps the core of bitter cherry, raspberry and damson plum notes in reserve for now. When they unfurl, they'll have support from elements of black tea, singed sandalwood, rose petal and oyster shell minerality through the mouthwatering finish. Best from 2026 through 2036. 624 cases made.

name: Barolo
tasting_note: Menthol, eucalyptus, tobacco and leather notes enhance the cherry and plum fruit in this fluid, relatively open red. A layer of flexible tannins informs the finish. Best from 2028 through 2042. 3,500 cases made, 1,600 cases imported.

name: Bourgogne Origines
tasting_note: Ripe with cherry, this is juicy and pure, showing accents of earth and leafy underbrush. Winds down leisurely, with balance, a firm edge and fine length. Drink now through 2028. 17,000 cases made, 11,000 cases imported.

name: Brut California
tasting_note: Sleek and lively, with pretty apple, strawberry and spiced nut flavors that linger on the bright finish. Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vermentino Colli di Luni-Liguria Grey Label
tasting_note: Ripe aromas and flavors of apricot and jasmine are offset by savory grass and sage notes in this crisp white. Balanced, ending with a salty, mouthwatering impression. Drink now. 30,000 cases made, 2,400 cases imported.

name: Botánico Gualtallary
tasting_note: Delicate notes of mountain herbs and almond verbena linger throughout this vibrant yet succulent white, with white peach and Asian pear flavors at the center, while a subtly salty and wet stone note generates a mouthwatering quality on the finish. Drink now through 2034. 3,300 cases made, 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cassis
tasting_note: Alluring notes of peach, green melon and meadow flowers are fresh and pure, revealing savory details of cut chives and flint smoke. Medium-weight and built upon a crushed mineral foundation, with great length and energy. Marsanne, Ugni Blanc, Clairette and Bourboulenc. Drink now through 2028. 549 cases imported.

name: The Spellbinder Columbia Valley
tasting_note: A lively and generous red, offering easygoing flavors of cherry, raspberry and spices that linger on the zesty finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2031. 1,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough The Ned
tasting_note: A faint salmon color announces this white's fresh and creamy notes of salted, ripe melon, nectarine and peach at the core. Hints of citrus zest and white flowers join a whiff of ginger and a hint of persimmon preserves. Drink now. 226,000 cases made, 1,500 cases imported.

name: Etna Rosato
tasting_note: A pale rosé, with just a touch of tawny hue, yet this shows good concentration in the glass, offering a well-cut mix of white cherry, pomegranate, pink grapefruit pith and mountain herbs, plus a minerally undertow that echoes on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made, 600 cases imported.

name: Malbec Paraje Altamira Nicasia Vineyard
tasting_note: A big, almost full-bodied style but opens with subtle, elegant notes of dried violet, thyme and dried orange peel that give way to a powerful, concentrated, structured core built around berry and plum flavors. There’s still Malbec’s hallmark velvety texture, but it is a contrast to the wave of chalky minerality. Finishes with glints of cassis and fig around structured tannins. Hands off for now. Best from 2027 through 2040. 1,833 cases made, 450 cases imported.

name: Merlot Spring Mountain District
tasting_note: Richly structured and polished, with multilayered black cherry, roasted coffee bean and toasted spice flavors that build depth and plushness toward big but supple tannins. Drink now through 2035. 867 cases made.

name: Pinot Nero dell'Otrepò Pavese Costa del Nero
tasting_note: A beam of dried and plumped cherry fruit flavors is pure and enticing, with fresh acidity, chalky tannins and a minerally underpinning. Dried dill and thyme, smoke and leather aromatics accent the cherry fruit and linger on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2030. 3,500 cases made, 700 cases imported.

name: Bourgogne Côte d'Or
tasting_note: Rich and dense, this red exhibits silky black cherry, black currant, violet, mineral and spice aromas and flavors. Its texture adds an extra dimension, white the flavors are propelled by vibrant acidity. Super long. Drink now through 2032. 504 cases imported.

name: Manzoni Bianco Vigneti delle Dolomiti Fontanasanta
tasting_note: Intriguing and enticing on the nose, with wild sage and quinine notes that are then savory accents for the palate's flavors of macerated white raspberry and mandarin orange zest. This is fresh, distinctive, medium-bodied and harmonious. A streak of salinity is a clean sweep on the persistent finish. Drink now through 2035. 1,700 cases made, 420 cases imported.

name: Ribera del Duero Carroa
tasting_note: A stylish, fluid red, with a dense core of fine-grained tannins enmeshed in a silky texture. Offers a pure beam of juicy cassis, plus enticing accents of anise hyssop, mountain herbs, mocha and toasted cumin. Long and detailed on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2040. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 4,000 cases made, 400 cases imported.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Three Palms Vineyard
tasting_note: Powerfully built yet refined and generous, with rich flavors of blackberry and red currant that take on toasty cinnamon, tomato leaf and spice flavors as this builds toward broad-shouldered tannins. Best from 2026 through 2033. 5,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Trois Sources
tasting_note: Shows subdued, hidden power and a gorgeous texture, though this is just beginning to unfurl. Warm earth, brown bread and toasted anise notes infuse a perfumed core of red fruit. Racy acidity keeps the tension high, and there's a licorice snap detail on the finish, which is defined, smoky and long. Grenache, Syrah, Cinsaut, Mourvèdre and Counoise. Best from 2027 through 2040. 2,200 cases made, 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford
tasting_note: Shimmers beautifully with cassis, mulberry puree and boysenberry pâte de fruit notes that glide over polished yet substantial tannins, while violet, anise and apple wood, plus a late ping of iron, fill in on the finish. Built for the cellar. Best from 2027 through 2040. 377 cases made.

name: Pessac-Léognan White
tasting_note: This shimmers with a salted butter note that adds a flattering edge to its panoply of shortbread, singed almond, honeysuckle, lemon curd and creamed white peach flavors. Feels regal, with a long finish that deftly toes the balance between the toasted and fresh, unadorned sides of the spectrum. A rare dry white that can handle all four seasons as anything from a solo aperitif to a main course partner. Beautiful. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Sauvignon Gris. Drink now through 2035. 2,000 cases made, 250 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Erdener Treppchen
tasting_note: Sweet and tangy, this delivers refreshing pleasure, offering a lush core of apple and meadow flowers. Crystalline purity dominates. The finish is precise and shows vibrant firmness, with a waft of smoke. Drink now. 2,000 cases made, 500 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape
tasting_note: Rich, spiced and beautifully textured, with fine-grained tannins guiding a beam of warm cherry and spices, all built around a graphite mineral spine. Inner freshness and purity keep tension through the luminous finish. Singed garrigue and sandalwood smoke echo on and on. Drink now through 2040.

name: Vinos de Madrid Sierra de Gredos Rozas de Puerto Real Valle del Tiétar
tasting_note: This graceful red is fresh and aromatic, not weighty but nicely structured, with a plush texture to its supple tannins. Offers flavors of plumped raspberry and strawberry fruit, blood orange peel, dried lavender, rosemary and thyme, plus a lovely skein of ground anise, pink peppercorn and paprika. Minerally stone and smoke notes linger on the creamy finish. Garnacha Tinta. Drink now through 2035. 941 cases made, 344 cases imported.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley In The Rocks
tasting_note: Deeply structured yet agile on its feet, with expressive flavors of raspberry and blueberry flanked by crushed stone, black olive, bay leaf and smoked meat tones that flesh out on the zesty ending. Drink now through 2033. 411 cases made.

name: St.-Joseph White Circa
tasting_note: A lush, showy style, with yellow plum and plush apple notes taking a creamy, mouthfilling turn on the palate. Verbena-edged acidity and a racy mineral vein keep the tension pulsing throughout. Baking spice details and a waft of smoke hover on the long finish, with a kick of salt and grapefruit pith. Drink now through 2028. 1,000 cases made, 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Saperavi South Australia Black Ops
tasting_note: Dense and complex, with rich notes of black walnut liqueur, salted black licorice and blackberry preserves, plus a hint of chocolate mint. The ripe huckleberry and spiced plum flavors show a lovely juicy quality, but it’s the grace notes, including chicory and loamy earth, that linger on the velvety frame. Shiraz and Saperavi. Drink now through 2038. 2,000 cases made, 300 cases imported.

name: Taurasi Gulielmus Riserva
tasting_note: A fresh, savory red, with milled pepper and cured tobacco notes on the nose and palate lacing flavors of baked cherry, pomegranate puree, iron, espresso and licorice root. Shows good length and integration, with a powerful frame of refined tannins providing limber muscle and firming the finish. Best from 2028 through 2040. 808 cases made, 300 cases imported.

name: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Clisson
tasting_note: There’s attractive richness to this Muscadet’s waxy quince and orchard fruit, laced with honeysuckle and dried green herbs. Silky and streamlined, with a long, harmonious finish and plenty of salty, mineral drive. Well-done. Drink now through 2028. 700 cases made, 150 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Niederösterreich Fass 4
tasting_note: There are flinty, smoky, yeasty undertones to the ripe, plump fruit profile in this delicious white. Savory chive and thyme and lacy, floral notes add complexity. The clean finish stretches out, showing salty freshness. Drink now through 2028. 150 cases imported.

name: Beaune Clos des Ursules Héritiers Louis Jadot
tasting_note: Pure and bursting with energy and tension, this red's cherry, blackberry, floral and mineral flavors are locked tight today. Nonetheless, this offers terrific balance and intensity, with just a hint of oak spice. The long, resonant aftertaste is driven by vibrant acidity. Shows excellent potential. Best from 2029 through 2047. 200 cases imported.

name: Rioja White Bhilar
tasting_note: Lightly gauzy and golden in hue, this silky white is fragrant with hints of honeysuckle and mint, offering flavors of raw almond, mandarin orange peel and dried white cherry. At first there's a pleasing succulence to the acidity, but then it's firm and refreshing, a clean-cut swathe on the salty finish. Long and distinctive. Viura and Grenache Blanc. Drink now through 2032. 1,000 cases made, 256 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa
tasting_note: Salted black licorice, cedar and dark chocolate notes mingle with cassis, blackberry and blueberry preserves on a dense frame alongside firm pepper accents and dense tannins. Finds finesse on the long finish, where the details fan out and malty Assam black tea details emerge. Drink now. 3,000 cases made, 350 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir West Sonoma Coast Estate Reserve
tasting_note: Sports a winey, sappy intensity, with iris and hibiscus notes liberally draped over a core of mulberry, raspberry and boysenberry coulis. There’s a mouthwatering spine of anise and apple wood through the finish, along with the vintage’s succulent acidity, giving this length and a well-structured feel as the fruit keeps pace. Best from 2026 through 2038. 326 cases made.

name: Savennières La Jalousie Château des Vaults
tasting_note: There’s brilliant freshness to this impressively concentrated, plump Chenin, with apple, pear, peach and star fruit notes showing ripeness yet crunchiness at the edges. Offers just the right hints of toasted, candied almond and pie crust, adding a pleasing element of decadence that’s well-balanced by a well of mineral, saline energy. Stunning. Drink now through 2040. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Cabernet Bosché
tasting_note: Leads with a burst of open-knit but persistent red and black cherry compote flavors. Modestly juicy energy keeps the fruit going, while subtle notes of cedar, iris and iron peek through the understated finish. Drink now through 2035. 1,479 cases made.
